info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 8:53PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Greensville and northeastern Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 1000 PM EDT... At 853 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alberta, or 8 miles north of Lawrenceville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lawrenceville around 910 PM EDT. Purdy around 940 PM EDT. Radium around 950 PM EDT. Emporia around 1000 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ante, Cochran, Rawlings, Bufford Crossroads, Triplet, Dolphin, Pleasant Shade, Fields Crossroads, Warfield and Emporia Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
